message:
Thank you so much for this. I've read so many articles and a bunch of books covering this topic, but the none made the lightbulb burn as brightly as it did in this one. You have a knack of distilling the essence of complex topics. So, please do write more.

The only thing I'm a bit hazy about is...when do you need to continue on the same context? Could someone point out a real world example? (i get the part where you don't need to use the same context to prevent deadlocks, so why isn't not continuing in a context given as a default by Microsoft?)
